headline: Shareholders sue Coinbase C-suite over alleged $4.2B insider sell-off
summary: A new group of Coinbase stockholders has filed a derivative lawsuit in Delaware, accusing the exchange’s leadership of engaging in a years-long scheme to unload $4.2 billion in stock at “artificially inflated” prices. A derivative lawsuit is a legal action brought by shareholders on behalf of the ...

headline: Stock market news: Dow, S&P, Nasdaq slip; US big pharma deal with UK, and Bitcoin falters
summary: December did not start well for the market, with all the major indices in the red. Will the theories urging caution against expecting a Santa Claus rally hold? Well, this is just Day 1, and for some, the Christmas tree decorations are still pending. So let us not entirely give up on the holiday ...

headline: Morgan Stanley Bullish on Citigroup (C)
summary: Citigroup Inc. (NYSE:C) is one of the best dividend stocks in the financial sector. On November 24, Morgan Stanley analyst Betsy Graseck assigned a Buy rating on Citi, while setting a price target of $134. In a separate business update dated October 27, Citi and Coinbase disclosed their collaboration plan, which improves digital asset payments […]

headline: Is Coinbase a Bargain After ETF Approval Buzz and Recent Price Swings?
summary: Wondering if Coinbase Global's wild ride means the stock is a bargain or just living up to the crypto hype? You're not alone. Figuring out the real value here is top-of-mind for many investors. The stock has seen turbulence recently, up 2.3% in the past week, but still down 24.4% over the last month and 16.0% over the past year. Longer-term holders have enjoyed a notable 512.7% return over three years. Recent headlines have kept Coinbase in the spotlight, as regulatory updates and changing...

headline: U.S. Futures Fall, Global Markets Mixed; Bitcoin Recovers Slightly
summary: Futures fell, breaking a five-day winning streak, and the dollar stayed weak after a selloff in cryptocurrencies in the prior session.

content.title: U.S. Futures Fall, Global Markets Mixed; Bitcoin Recovers Slightly

headline: Heard on the Street Recap Monday: Crypto Blues
summary: Confidence in crypto is melting. Bitcoin fell 6.4%, its largest daily decrease since March 3, according to Dow Jones Market Data. The decline knocked shares of crypto-focused companies, including Coinbase, Robinhood and Strategy.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap Monday: Crypto Blues
content.summary: Confidence in crypto is melting. Bitcoin fell 6.4%, its largest daily decrease since March 3, according to Dow Jones Market Data. The decline knocked shares of crypto-focused companies, including Coinbase, Robinhood and Strategy.

headline: Group of European banks announce euro stablecoin company called qivalis
summary: A group of 10 European banks, including heavyweights ING, ​UniCredit and BNP Paribas, have formed a consortium to launch ‌a euro-pegged stablecoin, in a move they hope will counter U.S. dominance ‌in digital payments.  The CEO of the Amsterdam-based company, named qivalis, will be Jan-Oliver Sell, who previously worked at Coinbase in Germany.  ING's digital asset lead Floris Lugt will be CFO, and former ⁠NatWest chair Howard Davies ‌will be chair, the group said at a press conference in Amsterdam on Tuesday.

content.title: Group of European banks announce euro stablecoin company called qivalis
content.summary: A group of 10 European banks, including heavyweights ING, ​UniCredit and BNP Paribas, have formed a consortium to launch ‌a euro-pegged stablecoin, in a move they hope will counter U.S. dominance ‌in digital payments.  The CEO of the Amsterdam-based company, named qivalis, will be Jan-Oliver Sell, who previously worked at Coinbase in Germany.  ING's digital asset lead Floris Lugt will be CFO, and former ⁠NatWest chair Howard Davies ‌will be chair, the group said at a press conference in Amsterdam on Tuesday.

thumbnail.caption: The ING Group logo is displayed at the headquarters where they announce its results for the fourth quarter and the whole of 2023, in Amsterdam

headline: European banks led by BNP, ING push ahead on euro stablecoin plan
summary: A group of 10 European banks, including ING, UniCredit and BNP Paribas, have formed a company to launch a euro-pegged stablecoin in the second ​half of 2026, in a move they hope will counter U.S. dominance in digital payments.  The CEO of the Amsterdam-based company,‌ named Qivalis, will be Jan-Oliver Sell, who was previously the CEO of crypto exchange Coinbase's German business, and has also worked for Binance.  Former NatWest ‌chair Howard Davies will be chair, the group said at a press conference in Amsterdam on Tuesday.

content.title: European banks led by BNP, ING push ahead on euro stablecoin plan
content.summary: A group of 10 European banks, including ING, UniCredit and BNP Paribas, have formed a company to launch a euro-pegged stablecoin in the second ​half of 2026, in a move they hope will counter U.S. dominance in digital payments.  The CEO of the Amsterdam-based company,‌ named Qivalis, will be Jan-Oliver Sell, who was previously the CEO of crypto exchange Coinbase's German business, and has also worked for Binance.  Former NatWest ‌chair Howard Davies will be chair, the group said at a press conference in Amsterdam on Tuesday.

thumbnail.caption: The ING Group logo is displayed at the headquarters where they announce its results for the fourth quarter and the whole of 2023, in Amsterdam

headline: 10 European Banks Form Stablecoin Company qivalis
summary: A coalition of ten major European banks has officially launched a new Amsterdam‑based company called qivalis to create a euro‑pegged stablecoin capable of countering the overwhelming dominance of US digital‑dollar systems. The consortium includes ING, UniCredit, BNP Paribas, Raiffeisen Bank International, SEB, Danske Bank, CaixaBank, KBC, Banca Sella, and DekaBank. ...

content.title: 10 European Banks Form Stablecoin Company qivalis
content.summary: A coalition of ten major European banks has officially launched a new Amsterdam‑based company called qivalis to create a euro‑pegged stablecoin capable of countering the overwhelming dominance of US digital‑dollar systems. The consortium includes ING, UniCredit, BNP Paribas, Raiffeisen Bank International, SEB, Danske Bank, CaixaBank, KBC, Banca Sella, and DekaBank. ...

headline: Tech stocks linked to Bitcoin take a battering as crypto traders brace for Strategy to breach danger threshold
summary: The leading Bitcoin treasury company's stock market cap is now worth less than the Bitcoin it holds.

headline: Stock Index Futures Gain as Investors Recover Risk Appetite
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.27%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are up +0.39% this morning, signaling a rebound from yesterday’s sell-off on Wall Street as investor risk appetite gradually returns at the start of December, a period that has historically been strong for markets.

content.title: Stock Index Futures Gain as Investors Recover Risk Appetite
content.summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.27%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are up +0.39% this morning, signaling a rebound from yesterday’s sell-off on Wall Street as investor risk appetite gradually returns at the start of December, a period that has historically been strong for markets.

headline: Bitcoin Rebounds Off Lows, Hitting $90,000
summary: Bitcoin rallied mid-morning in New York, bouncing back to $90,000 after suffering its worst day since March on Monday.  Crypto-sensitive stocks, including Strategy, Robinhood and Coinbase, also rose Tuesday.

content.title: Bitcoin Rebounds Off Lows, Hitting $90,000
content.summary: Bitcoin rallied mid-morning in New York, bouncing back to $90,000 after suffering its worst day since March on Monday.  Crypto-sensitive stocks, including Strategy, Robinhood and Coinbase, also rose Tuesday.
